Package com.atak.plugins.impl

Class AtakPluginRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atak.plugins.impl.AtakPluginRegistry
  • public final class AtakPluginRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  AtakPluginRegistry.Extension
      Each plugin can have multiple extensions where each extension describes a type (i.e., interface that the plugin implements), and the implementation of that type.
      static class  AtakPluginRegistry.PluginDescriptor
      Plugin's description, high-level element of plugin.xml, contains a list of Extensions, use SimpleXML to parse with this.
      static interface  AtakPluginRegistry.PluginLoadingProgressCallback

      • verifySignature

        public static boolean verifySignature​(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.lang.String pkgname)
        Verify the signature of the package matches the signature used to sign the TAK application. 
         Suppressed Lint warning because of the information in 
    Android FakeId Vulnerability
    Android FakeID Vulnerability Walkthrough
    and the fact that it is not used for anything more than printing 
    the current signatures.   If this is ever enabled as a true 
    verification, then the above links should be examined.
        Parameters:
        context - provided context for getting the package manager
        pkgname - the name of the package to check
        Returns:
        true if the signatures match.

        Verifies that a specific package can be trusted.
        Parameters:
        context - the context to use
        pkgname - the package name to look up
        Returns:
        true if trust can be verified

      • scanAndLoadPlugins

        public boolean scanAndLoadPlugins​(AtakPluginRegistry.PluginLoadingProgressCallback callback)
        Scan apps, parse plugin descriptors, loads all extensions for all plugins which are flagged \ as "shouldLoad" and are not already loaded
        Returns:
        if all of the plugins are to be considered trusted.

      • isTakCompatible

        public static boolean isTakCompatible​(java.lang.String packageName,
                                      java.lang.String pluginApiVersion)
        See if the specific plugin API version is compatible with this version of ATAK Currently must match exactly the ATAK plugin API version (from AndroidManifest.xml)
        Parameters:
        packageName - the package name
        pluginApiVersion - the api version
        Returns:
        true if the package is considered tak compatible.

      • getCoreApi

        public static java.lang.String getCoreApi​(java.lang.String api)
        Since the flavor will provide a packagename@apinumber.flavor, use this to strip the flavor off so we can determine if the plugin base is compatible. So this means every plugin can either be flavor compatible or base compatible
        Parameters:
        api - a properly formatted api
        Returns:
        the api with the flavor removed.

      • isAtak

        public static boolean isAtak​(android.content.pm.PackageInfo info)
        Check if the specified package is ATAK
        Parameters:
        info - the package to check
        Returns:
        true if the package is the main application.

      • isAtak

        public static boolean isAtak​(java.lang.String packageName)
        Check if the specified package is ATAK
        Parameters:
        packageName - the package name to check.
        Returns:
        true if the package describes the core application

      • compareVersions

        public static int compareVersions​(java.lang.String apiVersion1,
                                  java.lang.String apiVersion2)
        Provides for comparison of version strings used for ABI compatibility checks.
        Parameters:
        apiVersion1 - in the form of #.#.#.*
        apiVersion2 - in the form of #.#.#.*
        Returns:
        1 if abiVersion1 is higher than apiVersion2, 0 if they are equal or -1 if apiVersion1 is less than apiVersion2
